{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3183499,"name":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","username":"seanw","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seanw/{size}/120003_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T23:16:43.588Z","cooked":"

We seem plagued by communications and electrical problems. This weekend we had some disconnects that I’m not able to figure out. The pattern is:

DS logs report disconnect for about 7-9 seconds, then reconnect
DS logs show connection to the field (verified by FTA) but not pings to RIO
Cpu/memory fine
Voltage above RIO brownout

IMG_12851920×1440 522 KB

^^ picture of one from ~10:48:25-:33 (and the tail end of another one above)

My working theory is we experienced a momentary Ethernet disconnect which is consistent with a small disconnect like that, but I can’t find any logs on the rio disk to support it. I see /var/log/messages has the ifplugd logs but those look like they’re in volatile RAM.

Barring any secret places for me to look, is there a way to have the Rio persist some logs to flash so we can trace problems like this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T23:16:43.588Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":115.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/6/6/661708f5f150e8cb35fab4f40abe0567644f244f.jpeg","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38977,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2421 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/1","custom_user_title":"2421 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3183506,"name":"","username":"andej","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/ccd318/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T23:20:36.480Z","cooked":"

The roborio is a full linux computer, with its own filesystem.

This makes it pretty simple:

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

On-Robot Telemetry Recording Into Data Logs

By default, no telemetry data is recorded (saved) on the robot. The DataLogManager class provides a convenient wrapper around the lower-level DataLog class for on-robot recording of telemetry data ...

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T23:20:36.480Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":49.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/software/telemetry/datalog.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"On-Robot Telemetry Recording Into Data Logs — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52551,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"hugs","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183523,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T23:35:45.877Z","cooked":"

I agree it looks like the roborio disconnected from the radio and then reconnected a few seconds later. It’s too quick to be a full reboot, so the likely guess is a bad Ethernet connection somewhere along the way (bad cable, loose connection, broken port, etc). I’d definitely check out that whole path and maybe try switching in new Ethernet cables.

As far as the battery, you won’t have logs of the voltage during the disconnection (since the DS logs are done on the DS and need a connection to get the data to log). My guess is the log will just show the last reported value until it reconnects. But if you don’t see any major voltage drops before the disconnection, safe to assume that it’s not a voltage issue.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T23:35:45.877Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":35.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Ari Meles-Braverman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/3","custom_user_title":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183528,"name":"Technologyman00","username":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T23:38:34.138Z","cooked":"
AriMB:

As far as the battery, you won’t have logs of the voltage during the disconnection (since the DS logs are done on the DS and need a connection to get the data to log)

If it’s put to the NTs then the link @andej put will record it.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T23:38:34.138Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":29.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Technologyman00","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25951,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7900, 1792, 1714"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/4","custom_user_title":"7900, 1792, 1714","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183530,"name":"Technologyman00","username":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T23:41:16.142Z","cooked":"
AriMB:

bad Ethernet connection somewhere along the way (bad cable, loose connection, broken port, etc). I’d definitely check out that whole path and maybe try switching in new Ethernet cables.

If it’s none of these maybe try a different rio. We had one exhibiting similar problems this year.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T23:41:16.142Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":102,"readers_count":101,"score":25.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Technologyman00","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25951,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7900, 1792, 1714"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/5","custom_user_title":"7900, 1792, 1714","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183532,"name":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","username":"seanw","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seanw/{size}/120003_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T23:43:44.709Z","cooked":"
Technologyman00:

If it’s put to the NTs then the link @andej put will record it.

If it’s logging anything at all, that’s probably a good sign that the robot code is running.

We are using DataLogManager, and come to think of it, we’re logging the voltages that some of the speed controllers see.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T23:43:44.709Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":19.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38977,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2421 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/6","custom_user_title":"2421 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183534,"name":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","username":"seanw","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seanw/{size}/120003_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T23:45:10.576Z","cooked":"

Thanks. We had swapped cables. The only thing we didn’t do was hot glue all the connectors in, which I really wished we had done.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T23:45:10.576Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":21.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":25951,"username":"Technologyman00","name":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38977,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2421 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/7","custom_user_title":"2421 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3183538,"name":"Technologyman00","username":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-08T23:46:51.392Z","cooked":"

You shouldn’t have to hot glue Ethernet cables in. At least I never have heard or seen a team do so.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-08T23:46:51.392Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":15.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Technologyman00","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":38977,"username":"seanw","name":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seanw/{size}/120003_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25951,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7900, 1792, 1714"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/8","custom_user_title":"7900, 1792, 1714","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3185032,"name":"JBENJI","username":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T12:23:28.849Z","cooked":"

Did swapping out the ethernet cables fix your issue?
We had a similar 7-9 second loss of Rio a few matches this weekend at CHS Champs.
Definite correlation for us to collisions with another robot or banging over the cable tray.
We eventually taped down the ethernet connection on the Rio side of the Rev RPM and the problem didnt happen again - but we’re not sure yet that it wont happen again.

We’ll be doing some stuff to try to replicate in our shop before Worlds.

And - we shut off DataLogManager during competitions…

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T12:23:28.849Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":61,"readers_count":60,"score":22.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"JBENJI","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28067,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3185037,"name":"Mark McLeod","username":"Mark_McLeod","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mark_mcleod/{size}/65145_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T12:40:19.044Z","cooked":"

Look at the complete Ethernet path between the radio and Rio.
For instance, some teams have started to put network switches in the critical path between the radio and the Rio. When the switch has a momentary power outage it generally takes 5-10 seconds to reboot, interrupting the Rio network connection.

The Rev POE or CTRE VRM based POE are also potential points of Ethernet disruption.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T12:40:19.044Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":31.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Mark McLeod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2123,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Itinerant Troubleshooter"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/10","custom_user_title":"Itinerant Troubleshooter","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3185039,"name":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","username":"seanw","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seanw/{size}/120003_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T12:42:28.979Z","cooked":"

No, changing cables didn’t do anything, and we do think it’s correlated to collisions or the tray (we were at CHS, too). We’d used a switch before, but for the whole competition we were using the orange POE cable and a short male-male directly between the radio and the Rio.

I haven’t checked yet to see if we have DataLogManager logs (indicating the Rio was running fine), but I’m pretty sure we’ll have logs there.

Before we pack up for the year I’m hoping we can find time to drive around the parking lot and see if we can reproduce and find a fix.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T12:42:28.979Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":16.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":28067,"username":"JBENJI","name":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38977,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2421 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/11","custom_user_title":"2421 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3185058,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T13:01:31.967Z","cooked":"
seanw:

we were using the orange POE cable

I can’t say for certain, but statistically speaking, this is likely the problem. Nearly every team I’ve seen with this issue (5-10 second rio-only disconnect) either had a network switch along the critical path that lost power, or were using the orange POE cable.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T13:01:31.967Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":48,"readers_count":47,"score":29.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/12","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3185072,"name":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","username":"seanw","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seanw/{size}/120003_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T13:24:38.379Z","cooked":"
Fletch1373:

I can’t say for certain, but statistically speaking, this is likely the problem. Nearly every team I’ve seen with this issue (5-10 second rio-only disconnect) either had a network switch along the critical path that lost power, or were using the orange POE cable.

Oh man, I wish I had some actual data here.

We started the tournament with the Orange POE cable and the barrel connector because last year were were told “you want redundant power”.

After getting 3 disconnects in one match, we listened to the people that said “those orange POE cables are evil”, so we got rid of it and went to a straight through Ethernet cable.

Well, guess what? The barrel connector was unreliable. We spent the match before that sitting idle because we kept losing radio. We had the FTAs come to our pit, we did some testing, which found out that the barrel connector came loose easily leading to a radio reboot. So on the advice of the FTA and other volunteers, we got rid of it and went back to the POE connector since they spoke so highly of them and so poorly of the barrel connectors.

In my perfect world I’d break open the radio case and solder in power cables to go directly to the supply, but am not sure if that’s allowed or not. Then we wouldn’t need POE.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T13:24:38.379Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":45,"readers_count":44,"score":19.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Sean W - 2421 Software Mentor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38977,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2421 Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/13","custom_user_title":"2421 Software Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3185079,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T13:33:30.176Z","cooked":"
seanw:

not sure if that’s allowed or not

It’s not. That would be modification of the component (though I don’t have the specific rule handy).

In general… RPM > orange POE+barrel > just orange POE > just barrel (note you’re not allowed to use RPM + barrel)

They all have failure modes, but this is my preference in order of prevalence/frequency of failures

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2023-04-10T13:33:30.176Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":23.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":433423,"topic_slug":"rio-logs","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/rio-logs/433423/14","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3185084,"name":"JBENJI","username":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-10T13:36:51.345Z","cooked":"

Hmm - we are set up with the radio and the Rev RPM and then a miniPC coprocessor (for vision processing) that we configured as an ethernet switch.
Also using a RoboRio 2 with the SD card slot…I thought that might be related so taped over that SD slot, but I think we experienced the 9 second problem once after I taped.

So - same event, same random (but collision induced) Rio disconnects, but different robot configurations.

We have a plan to work our way through ethernet cables, connections, and devices to see if we can replicate in our shop and prevent it from happening at Worlds

seanw:

After getting 3 disconnects in one match, we listened to the people that said “those orange POE cables are evil”, so we got rid of it and went to a straight through Ethernet cable.

“Those orange POE cables” aren’t evil, they just don’t have the best QC. On most robots they work well and were a huge leap forward in terms of reliably getting power to the radio. On a few percent of cables, the data lines have bad connections and give a flaky signal. If you have one of those bad cables, my suggestion isn’t to go without it but to replace it with another one (which will likely not have that problem).
